item.description:
Anyone interested in Warren Buffett or Benjamin Graham-based investing is invited.

The meeting format is as follows:
  • Austin Sher will argue why or why not we should invest in Phillips-Van Heusen (PVH).
  • The company's latest 10K is here.
  • Our goal is to question the basis of Austin's arguments and assumptions.
  • The more prepared we are, the more beneficial our debate will be.



We will meet at the entrance doors of MIT's Stata Center at 6:30pm. Specifically, the meeting point is the entrance to Building 32 (also known as the Gates Building) on Main Street and Vassar Street. We will then use room G725 in the Stata Center. The doors are only accessible with an MIT card, so please arrive on time. Here's a campus map showing the Stata Center.


Note: at our last meeting, on 11/18/08, Raimondas Lencevicius presented Harley-Davidson. His presentation is here.
item.name: Boston Value Investing Group
